item.title: Vapor-Liquid Equilibrium Demonstrator
item.description: Hand boilers are used to demonstrate vapor-liquid equilibrium. The colored liquid in the boiler is comprised of a volatile mixture of liquids that have a boiling point close to room temperature. When someone places their hands in the lower chamber, body heat increases the gas temperature and causes the gas to expand. The heat also causes some liquid to evaporate, which further expands the gas and pushes the liquid upwards.
